text: Zhou Yihan (; born 30 January 1994) is a China-born Singaporean table tennis player. Born in China, she moved to Singapore in 2009 via the Foreign Sports Talent Scheme. She was eligible to play in 2011.Glasgow 2014 biography Zhou won a team gold at the 2014 Commonwealth Games and a team Bronze at the 2014 Asian Games. On 2 June 2015, Zhou and her compatriot, Lin Ye, defeated top seed, Feng Tianwei and Yu Mengyu 4-3 to clinch the Women Doubles title in 28th Southeast Asian Games held in Singapore.SEA Games table tennis: Singapore win first 28th SEA Games gold, silver The pair continued their good momentum and caused one of the biggest upset in history when they defeated the top doubles pair Ding Ning and Liu Shiwen 3-0 in ITTF World Tour, Japan Open Semi-FinalLin Ye and Zhou in dream run but lost to another China pair of Wu Yang and Liu Fei in Final. == 2016 Summer Olympics == Zhou was selected as the third player for Rio de Janeiro Olympics by Singapore Table Tennis Association. She will be joining Feng Tianwei and Yu Mengyu in the team event. This will be her Olympics debut.Zhou earns nod in Rio Feng, Yu and Zhou reached the semi-final of the team event but lost to China 0-3.
